subject: docs: expand guide with vue-i18n-extract.js examples
commitMessage:
docs: expand guide with vue-i18n-extract.js examples

This internationalization documentation patch provides the developers
with specific recommendations on using vue-i18n-extract.js tool to
ensure translations consistency.

Signed-off-by: Paul Fertser <fercerpav@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I506091c97043ad3f50c4753daddd450abe9744fc

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Ok-To-Test+1

User approved, CI ok to start

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build Successful 

https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/22543/ : SUCCESS

Patch Set 1:

Following the proposed procedures I spotted few recent omissions in the English translation. The authors of the commits in question are notified via Gerrit comments on the corresponding changes; I hope this works even though the changes were already merged.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

Thank you for this commit to the documentation!

Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Following the proposed procedures I spotted few recent omissions in the English translation. The authors of the commits in question are notified via Gerrit comments on the corresponding changes; I hope this works even though the changes were already merged.

I see the 5 missing and the unused keys. We can work to resolve these!
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I added comments to https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/42074 and https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/39686 hoping the authors would notice and resolve those. Does it not work like that?

If the commits are already merged, we can resolve with new commits. I believe you provided comments after merge. I don't think we need to roll any changes back to resolve the problems. Do you agree?

Sure thing. I just thought that commenting on merged changes is a handy and sensible way to contact their authors in the hopes they send a follow-up commit if desired.

Do you want me to Submit this without fixing the typo in the commit message?

That's one nice long word that should be even longer.
😂 For sure. Should it be internationalization? Which is actually longer.
Yep
What is CLI in this context? I see you didn't add it here, but maybe you know? This is the first occurrence of it in this document.
I do not really know, sorry. I wouldn't bother since creating en-US.json file is a one-time operation and it was performed for webui-vue long time ago already :)
